content: People coming from slack will be very used to Ctrl-K doing something. Should we just map it to our q?
I would save ctrl-K for an actual jump menu.

what's the different between a jump menu and our q? Just that it includes PMs?
This is slack's Ctrl-K on a new realm, so without other people.
pasted image
ah, Slack's Ctrl-K takes you to just unreads

I think if we made it work now as q, we could change to just unreads later, if people really wanted that.
I think the benefit of having it do somethnig now is that people coming from slack (that use slack heavily) are used to navigating with ctrl-K, and so having that do something reasonable would be be good, even if we change it later.
It just sets us up for backward-incompatibility issues. Ideally our control-K menu would be smart enough to include PMs, for example. Also, Slack is a popup, which is what I think we want.
